Education can change your life! You have taken the first step already by registering on the MyMargdarshaka App.
You will find your assigned mentors along with their contact details, in the ‘My Mentors’ page, accessible from the side menu.
Your mentors have been assigned according to your class, which subjects you want to learn, your ‘Preferred Language of Instruction’ and your ‘Preferred Time Slot’.
Please contact your mentors as soon as you get their contact information and enquire how to coordinate with them about classes, assignments and exams.

Although there is no compulsion to take exams by being registered on the platform, it is strictly recommended that you register for, prepare well and take the Secondary (10th standard) and Senior Secondary (12th standard) certification from the National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS), which is the Government of India’s official examination and certification portal for non-traditional schooling.

Please try to make the best of the platform and the guidance given to you by your mentor. Good luck to you as you pursue your education sincerely!
You are your students’ mentor or ‘Margdarshak’ which means you have the noble responsibility of showing them their way through education!
You can find the list of your assigned students, along with their details, on the ‘My Students’ page, accessible from the side menu.

Your students have been assigned to you keeping in mind the class and subjects that you have volunteered to teach. They also have the same ‘Preferred Language of Instruction’ and ‘Preferred Time Slot’ so that it will be easier for you to reach them.
Please contact your students as soon as they are assigned to you and coordinate with them about how to go about mentoring them.

Although you are free to use your creativity and discretion in your mentorship, you are advised to keep some main ideas in mind. Your students should be able to get Secondary (10th standard) and Senior Secondary (12th standard) certification from the National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS), which is the Government of India’s official examination and certification portal for non-traditional schooling.

string.name: m_guideline6
string.a: Please refer to the syllabus and procedure for taking the examinations given in the NIOS website.

resources.string: Please encourage your students to take the certification exams and guide them through the process as much as possible.

Please try to understand the variable situations that your students might be going through and try to conduct classes and provide assignments in a way that works for them. They may not be very comfortable with technology, so please take the time to get them onboard. Try to conduct regular classes, give assignments and make the best use of available resources.
